  • Description: RESPONDED TO A GROUND LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE, UPON ARRIVAL WE NOTICED THE PACKAGE HAD A CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. WE FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND THE CORROSIVE SHEET. WE PUT ON THE APPROPRIATE PPE AND BROUGHT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2025070985
item.description:
Report X-2025070985

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-28
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Loaded car being serviced by NS crew noticed during movement a flash of vapor above the referenced car just outside of the industry at Campground Rd. Trainmaster and crew isolated appropriately, industry personnel were contacted and mounted the car for inspection and discovered a flange bolt on the fill port was not completely tool tight allowing a small amount of product to escape. Car was re placed in industry for thorough review and securement.

item.title: Report E-2025060531
item.description:
Report E-2025060531

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 25, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3082 had a leaking lid and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew replaced the damaged lid with a new cap and utilized granular absorbents to collect the released product. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 5-gallon pail.

item.title: Report E-2025070390
item.description:
Report E-2025070390

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-17
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) ounce of material released from one (1) 5-gallon jerrican due to a forklift accident that resulted in the jerrican being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and jerrican and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025061996
item.description:
Report X-2025061996

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-16
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Operation Supervisor states that they opened up trailer 552565 in dock door 9 when they found a pallet of UN2880, CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED, 5.1, PG II, RQ, CALCIUM that had not been shrink wrapped properly and fell onto another hazmat shipment of UN2014, HYDROGEN PEROXIDE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION S, 5.1 (8), PG II resulting in 5 fl oz of the spill to foam up on the trailer floor. ABF Supervisor states that none of it hit the yard. ABF Supervisor states that the freight had also not been properly blocked or braced for the UN2880 hazmat pallet which is what resulted in the spill to occur. ABF Supervisor states that a really small amount of both hazmats did make contact but a majority of it was still sealed. Safety advised supervisor to block the spill off from it spreading additionally until CURA arrived on-site to clean it. Safety contacted CURA and they're dispatch someone on emergency response for cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2025061669
item.description:
Report X-2025061669

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-12
  • City: WALTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: I WAS CALLED TO A HAZMAT LEAKER ON PD2. WHEN I ARRIVED I SAW THE CORROSIVE HAZMAT LABEL AND GOT OUT MY DECISON TREE AND FOLLOWED IT TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. I PUT ON MY PPE AND CONTAINED THE SPILL AND TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2025061799
item.description:
Report X-2025061799

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWO AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGES WERE DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS WORLDPORT LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY FACILITY. BOTH PACKAGES ARE FULLY MARKED AND LABELED AS DANGEROUS GOODS. EACH PACKAGE HAS A SHIPPER DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS AND PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN FLORIDA. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TRACKING NUMBER 1Z3995330149591165 CONTAINED (4) ONE GALLON METAL CANS OF PAINT. TWO OF THE CANS ARE LEAKING FROM WHAT APPEARS TO BE DENTED OR CRUSHED AT THE BOTTOM. TRACKING NUMBER 1Z3995330149876152 CONTAINED (2) ONE GALLON METAL CANS OF PAINT WITH ONE LEAKING FROM WHAT APPEARS TO BE SLIGHTLY DENTED AT THE BASE OF THE CAN. BOTH OUTER BOXES ARE COMPROMISED WITH THE LEAKING CONTENTS.

item.title: Report X-2025061971
item.description:
Report X-2025061971

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY FACILITY ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM THE NETHERLANDS TO CALIFORNIA, USA WAS STOPPED FOR INSPECTION BY IMPORT INSPECTION OFFICER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS THE OFFICER DISCOVERED A SINGLE APPROXIMATELY FOUR OUNCE JAR OF FLAMMABLE COLORED FLAME PASTE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2025050426
item.description:
Report E-2025050426

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: RUSSELL
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 200000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On May 20th, 2025, at 0609 hours, personnel in the CSXT Russell Yard discovered PROX90809, a loaded tank car of Anhydrous Ammonia, leaking from the top of car. The car was isolated and the shipper, PCS Sales Inc., was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #0520-2025-00044). Quick Response, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found ammonia vapor actively releasing from the pressure relief valve (PRV). Additional response personnel installed a Midland capping kit over the leaking PRD to contain the release. The car was then trans-loaded, nitrogen purged, and prepped for home shop. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Matt Paynter (706-564-8118).

item.title: Report E-2025070231
item.description:
Report E-2025070231

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the damaged drum with product and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
